Program Name: Work Opportunity Tax Credit (WOTC) for Veterans
Notes: Federal tax credit for employers who hire qualified veterans, administered through IDES in Illinois

Status Details: Active tax_credit program with direct employer benefit
Notes: State income tax credit for employers who hire veterans of Operation Desert Storm, Operation Enduring Freedom, or Operation Iraqi Freedom
Federal tax credit for employers who hire individuals with disabilities who are receiving SSI or veterans with service-connected disabilities

Program Name: Illinois Income Tax Credit for Hiring Individuals with Developmental Disabilities
Status Details: Active tax_credit program with direct employer benefit
Notes: Illinois state income tax credit available to employers who hire and retain individuals with developmental disabilities or severe mental illness

Agency: Illinois Department of Employment Security (IDES) / IRS
Notes: Federal tax credit for employers hiring qualified ex-felons within one year of conviction or release from prison

Status Details: Active tax_credit program with direct employer benefit
Notes: Illinois state tax credit equal to 5% of wages paid to qualified ex-felons, originally introduced in 2006

Program Name: Illinois Formerly Incarcerated Hiring Tax Credit
Status Details: Active tax_credit program with direct employer benefit
Notes: New Illinois tax credit beginning January 1, 2025, providing up to $7,500 per hire for employers hiring formerly incarcerated individuals

Agency: U.S. Department of Labor / Illinois Department of Employment Security
Notes: Free fidelity bonding insurance for employers hiring at-risk job seekers including ex-offenders, protecting against employee theft

Status Details: Active wage_subsidy program with direct employer benefit
Notes: Program that pays wage subsidies to employers who hire TANF program participants

Status Details: Active tax_credit program with direct employer benefit
Max Value: Up to $2,100 for hiring high-risk youth
Notes: Employer wage credits up to $2,100 for hiring 'high-risk youth' who reside in specific areas, part of Chicago's business incentive programs

Agency: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
Status Details: Active tax_credit program with direct employer benefit
Notes: State income tax credit for businesses located in Illinois Enterprise Zones that hire qualified employees, including those from disadvantaged groups

Program Name: Illinois Small Business Job Creation Tax Credit
Status Details: Active tax_credit program with direct employer benefit
Notes: State tax credit for small businesses that create new full-time positions, potentially applicable to hiring long-term unemployed workers

Agency: U.S. Department of Labor, Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
Max Value: Up to 50% wage reimbursement (up to 75% for small businesses)
Notes: Provides wage reimbursement to employers for training new employees with specific skills and employment competencies

Max Value: Varies by track - includes education, training, and employment services
Notes: Comprehensive program providing vocational rehabilitation and employment assistance including Independent Living track for veterans with service-connected disabilities

Max Value: No direct payment - provides training experience and VA support
Notes: Provides work experience opportunities for veterans with VA support during the training period, including training outlines and required tools/equipment guidance

Agency: U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, Veteran Readiness and Employment
Max Value: Varies - financial incentives for hiring eligible veterans
Notes: Initiative providing incentives to employers for hiring eligible veterans who face employment challenges, with VA determining veteran eligibility

Max Value: Free training/internship - servicemember continues receiving military pay
Notes: Enables servicemembers to gain civilian work experience through industry training, apprenticeships, and job skills programs during their last 180 days of service
